episodes.original_body:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020
Client: Estate of Keith Graser

Filed Form 104, Form 105, 45 Day Disclosures & Supporting Medical Documentation
45DD - Dr. Jawed Nasim - Infectious Disease Baptist - Evaluated Keith upon admission to Baptist 12/13/20 & Dr. Henry Byrum - Internal Medicine - St. Matt Med Assoc - Treating Phy for Lung Cancer
Supporting Med Doc: 1 page from Baptist Hospital Narrative - States "Keith B Graser is a 62 y.o. male who presents to the ED c/o rather abrupt onset of fever and shortness of
breath yesterday. He has had a cough productive of brownish sputum. He feels achy all over and has had a
headache. He had been staying at home up until last week when he went back to work. He reports limited
compliance with masking and social distancing at his place of employment.
Of note, he is status post chemotherapy and radiation for B-cell lymphoma. He presented with sepsis earlier this
year with similar symptoms."
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. The client is the Estate of Keith Graser, and the matter involves the filing of Form 104, Form 105, 45 Day Disclosures, and Supporting Medical Documentation. Under 45 Day Disclosures (45DD), Dr. Jawed Nasim, an Infectious Disease specialist at Baptist, evaluated Keith upon admission to Baptist on December 13, 2020, and Dr. Henry Byrum of Internal Medicine at St. Matthew Medical Associates was the treating physician for Keith’s lung cancer.

The supporting medical documentation consists of one page from the Baptist Hospital Narrative. The narrative states: "Keith B Graser is a 62 y.o. male who presents to the ED c/o rather abrupt onset of fever and shortness of breath yesterday. He has had a cough productive of brownish sputum. He feels achy all over and has had a headache. He had been staying at home up until last week when he went back to work. He reports limited compliance with masking and social distancing at his place of employment. Of note, he is status post chemotherapy and radiation for B-cell lymphoma. He presented with sepsis earlier this year with similar symptoms."
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

Jeremy Leitner

> On Feb 11, 2022, at 4:21 PM, Aaron Whaley wrote:
> 
> ?Jeremy I sent you an email earlier this week. Did you get it? I’m looking to get a workers comp opinion on a Covid infection. --

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser.

This Re: Covid matter concerns an email exchange from February 2022 regarding a workers’ compensation opinion on a Covid infection. On February 11, 2022, at 4:21 PM, Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm wrote to Jeremy Leitner, asking whether he had received an earlier email and stating that he was seeking a workers’ compensation opinion on a Covid infection. Aaron provided his firm’s details: Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and his phone number, 502-583-4022.

Later that same day, Friday, February 11, 2022, at 11:58:44 PM +0000, Jeremy Leitner, who is the Vice President of Development for CommonwealthIME (jeremy@commonwealthime.com), replied to Aaron and CC’d Sarena Tuttle (sarena@whaleylawfirm.com). In his message, Leitner apologized, saying he thought he had replied to Aaron. He noted that Dr. Barefoot is happy to look at the matter and that they would get it all together on Monday. He closed with, “Have a great weekend,” and provided his contact information: Jeremy Leitner, Vice President of Development, 502.779.0797, WWW.COMMONWEALTHIME.COM.

Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser. This matter concerns Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction.

In February 2022, communications occurred between The Whaley Law Firm and U’Sellis Mayer & Associates regarding Form 106 and related administration in the estate. On February 7, 2022, Angie Burns, a Paralegal at U’Sellis Mayer & Associates (600 East Main Street, Suite 100, Louisville, KY 40202; phone 502-736-3600; fax 502-736-3606; aburns@umakylaw.com), emailed agwhaley@louisville-accident-lawyer.com noting that the firm had not yet received a Form 106 for the claim identified as LA 2075 and requesting that it be forwarded at the earliest convenience.

On February 17, 2022, Angie Burns followed up again with a request for the Form 106 in the Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction matter. That message was forwarded within the chain, with Aaron Whaley of The Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; phone 502-583-4022; email sarena@whaleylawfirm.com; please note new email address) involved in the discussion.

On February 18, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm responded to Angie Burns, stating that the Form 106 for Estate of Keith Graser was attached and that the Form had been executed by the Administratrix, Nancy Graser. The message indicated that if anything else was needed, Angie's office should feel free to contact The Whaley Law Firm to discuss it further.

Later, on February 21, 2022, at 3:32 p.m. (15:32:59 -0500), Sarena sent another email noting that she was enclosing the order appointing Nancy Graser Administratrix. She also stated that, at that time, The Whaley Law Firm did not have a copy of Keith Graser’s death certificate on file and that she had reached out to Nancy to obtain a copy for the office as soon as possible. The email concluded with Sarena’s sign-off and contact details, including the instruction to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

That same day, the recipient, Angie Burns, replied at 2:16 p.m., thanking The Whaley Law Firm for the Form 106 but indicating a need for two additional items: (1) the copy of the Order appointing the Administratrix (Administratrix as spelled in the notice) and (2) a copy of the death certificate.

In the chain, the following signature blocks and contact details appeared: Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, with the office address and numbers listed above, and a note to contact directly if more information was needed; Nancy Graser was referenced as the Administratrix in the documents; and the correspondence repeatedly included the subject line Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction. The exchange also contains the earlier communications showing the file designation “Our File: LA 2075” and the repeated request for Form 106 and the missing death certificate, along with the request for the order appointing the Administratrix.

Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser.

Re: Graser, K.

On February 25, 2022 at 10:03 AM, Brian Dietsche of CommonwealthIME emailed Sarena Tuttle regarding Mr. Graser’s records. He said he was going through the records for Mr. Graser and had spoken with Dr. Barefoot about the case, who provided him with a list of questions to ask. He asked to clarify Mr. Graser’s work situation, noting that he had been described as a construction foreman and inquiring what that role consisted of. Specifically, he asked whether the work was residential or commercial construction, whether Mr. Graser worked in an office building or a trailer, and what his day consisted of—such as whom he interacted with, whether he was in an office all day, and what he actually did during the day. He requested a work note that cleared him to go back to work, such as a letter or consultation from his oncologist. He added that there wasn’t much in the records from his oncologist and asked if there was anything else available, such as the last consult note or its date.

On February 28, 2022 at 10:09:39 -0500, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm replied to Brian. She thanked him for the email, apologized for being out Friday, and said she would work on getting the information over as soon as possible. Her signature included her contact information: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Direct line 502-365-9435; Office line 502-583-4022; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note that this is her new email address.

She further advised that Keith’s mentor took him on a “Pony & Show” tour upon his return to be welcomed back; this is when Keith noticed the lack of a mask and that a couple of co-workers had runny noses and coughs.

Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser. This note concerns the deposition of Nancy Graser in Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction, UMA File DAU/REN LA 2075.

The exchange began with an email chain regarding scheduling Nancy Graser’s deposition. On April 25, 2022, Jessica Wiedersatz, a paralegal with U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, wrote to Aaron Whaley requesting to schedule Ms. Graser’s deposition. Doug U’Sellis would like the deposition to be held in person, and they are willing to travel to Aaron’s office if preferred. Jessica listed several available dates: May 9, May 13, May 18, May 19, May 20, and May 23, 2022, with start times of either 10:00 a.m. or 2:00 p.m. Eastern. She asked for confirmation of what would work for Aaron and Ms. Graser.

The email thread shows the scheduling discussion continuing, with Aaron Whaley forwarding the message and the corresponding reply being circulated in the chain. In the body of the April 25 correspondence, Jessica reiterated the dates and flexibility, inviting a firm to indicate which dates and times would work for all parties.

Later on April 25, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm responded to Jessica: Mrs. Graser is available at 2:00 p.m. on May 18, 2022 for her deposition, and they are willing to come to Jessica’s location. Sarena provided her firm’s contact information and noted the new email address for future correspondence: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, along with the firm’s Louisville, Kentucky address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and direct lines D: (502) 365-9435 and O: (502) 583-4022.

On April 27, 2022 at 11:42 a.m., Jessica replied, thanking Sarena and stating that she had attached the deposition notice, asking Sarena to confirm receipt of the notice. Later that same day, at 12:29 p.m., Sarena replied to confirm receipt of the notice and again expressed thanks to Jessica. Sarena’s signature block reiterates the firm’s contact details and reminds the reader to note the new email address.

For completeness, the communications reference the relevant case details: the Estate of Keith Graser is the client, the matter is Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction, and the UMA file is DAU/REN LA 2075. The deposition is identified as the deposition of Nancy Graser in this matter, with the stated availability of 2:00 p.m. on May 18, 2022, and the parties’ mutual willingness to conduct the deposition in person at a location convenient to the parties.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser. The matter is titled Estate of Keith Graser v Coupe Construction.

In the email thread related to the Estate of Keith Graser v Coupe Construction, Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent an initial correspondence to Doug U’Sellis of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, with Aaron Whaley and Rick Neal of The Whaley Law Firm CC’d. The thread shows communications occurring in May 2022. The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details are listed as 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line (502) 365-9435; office line (502) 583-4022; and the email address Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note indicating a new email address.

On May 26, 2022, at 4:13 PM, Doug U’Sellis wrote to Aaron and Sarena. He reported that Ms. Graser had testified that her husband’s pulmonary specialist was a doctor referred to as “Dr. Windsor,” but the law firm could not locate any pulmonologist by that name. He asked that Aaron and Sarena check with the widow to confirm the correct name and, if possible, to determine where the doctor was located or which practice he or she was affiliated with. Doug signed as Douglas A. U’Sellis of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, located at 600 East Main Street, Suite 100, Louisville, KY 40202. His phone number was (502) 736-3600, with fax (502) 736-3606, and the website www.umakylaw.com. His email was dusellis@umakylaw.com. The email also included a note indicating the message was created using voice recognition software and advising to reply to the sender or call the listed number with any questions.

The following day, May 27, 2022, at 9:35 AM, Sarena Tuttle replied to Mr. U’Sellis. She stated that she had reached out to Nancy but had to leave Nancy a voicemail and was awaiting a callback. In the meantime, she would review the documents on hand to locate the requested information. This message again carried Sarena’s signature for The Whaley Law Firm, with the same address and contact numbers as noted above, and the reminder that her email address is Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, labeled “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

Later that same day (and continuing the thread), a prior message from May 26 is reflected in the correspondence, where Sarena’s earlier note included her name, firm, and contact information, reiterating that she would be checking the documents to locate the required information and that she had left a voicemail for Nancy.

Separately, in the body of the May 26 exchange, the subject of the inquiry concerned the identity and location of the husband’s pulmonary specialist. Doug had asked the recipients to confirm the correct doctor’s name and, if necessary, to determine where the doctor practiced. The thread as a whole centers on confirming the correct physician’s name for the deceased’s spouse and locating the doctor’s practice information, with Nancy providing clarification that the correct physician is Dr. David Winslow, not Windsor. Nancy’s correction identifies Dr. David Winslow as the pulmonary specialist, and provides the office location at 3430 Newburg Road and the phone number (502) 559-5864.

In summary: the case concerns the Estate of Keith Graser in a matter against Coupe Construction. A disagreement over the correct pulmonologist’s name occurred, with initial reports citing Dr. Windsor. Doug requested verification and location details for the doctor. Sarena later reported that Nancy had clarified the physician’s name as Dr. David Winslow, not Windsor, and provided the office address (3430 Newburg Road) and phone number (502) 559-5864. Sarena indicated she would continue to pursue the information and invited any further contact if more details were needed. The communications were between The Whaley Law Firm (Sarena M. Tuttle) and U’Sellis Mayer & Associates (Douglas A. U’Sellis), with CC’d colleagues Aaron Whaley and Rick Neal on the Whaley firm’s side.

In the case captioned Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020, with the client listed as the Estate of Keith Graser, the matter is Estate of Keith Graser v Coupe Construction. On Friday, May 27, 2022, at 14:31:17 UTC, Douglas A. U’Sellis of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates sent an email to Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm regarding that case, titled “Re: Estate of Keith Graser v Coupe Construction.” The body of the message consisted of a simple “Thank you!” The email included U’Sellis’ signature block containing his office address at 600 East Main Street, Suite 100, Louisville, KY 40202; phone number (502) 736-3600; fax number (502) 736-3606; website www.umakylaw.com; and email address dusellis@umakylaw.com. The message also carried the standard note that the email was created using voice recognition software, with instructions to reply to the sender or call (502) 736-3600 if there were questions. An attachment noted as a small PNG image was present in the message, and the email was sent to Sarena Tuttle at sarena@whaleylawfirm.com, with CCs to Aaron Whaley at agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com, Rick Neal at agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com, and aburns@umakylaw.com.

Earlier correspondence shows that on May 26, 2022 at 16:13, Doug U’Sellis wrote to Aaron and Sarena: “Hi Aaron and Sarena, Ms. Graser testified that her husband’s pulmonary specialist was a ‘Dr. Windsor’. We cannot locate a pulmonologist by that name. I would appreciate if you could check with her further to make sure we have the correct name. If so, please see if she knows where the doctor was located or what practice he or she was with. Thanks.” This message also included Doug’s signature block with his firm’s address and contact information, and it noted the presence of a small PNG attachment, as well as the disclaimer about voice recognition software.

On May 27, 2022 at 9:35 AM, Sarena Tuttle replied to Mr. U’Sellis: “Good morning Mr. U'Sellis, I have reached out to Nancy but unfortunately had to leave her a voicemail and await a call back. In the meantime, I will review the documents we have and see if I can locate this information.” Sarena’s signature listed The Whaley Law Firm at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with direct line 502-365-9435, office line 502-583-4022, and email address Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, along with a note indicating a new email address.

Later that same day, on May 27, 2022 at 10:11 AM, Sarena followed up: “Good morning again, Nancy states it is Dr. David Winslow, not Windsor. His office is located at 3430 Newburg Road and their phone number is (502) 559-5864. If you need anything else, please feel free to contact us directly to discuss it in further detail.” This update corrected the physician’s name from Windsor to Winslow and provided the office address and telephone number for Dr. Winslow.

Throughout these exchanges, the participants included Nancy (a contact at the doctor’s office) and the attorneys at The Whaley Law Firm and U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, with the relevant email addresses and signatures noted above.

Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. The client is the Estate of Keith Graser, and the matter was being tracked under the subject line Re: Keith Graser. In August 2022, two Whaley Law Firm attorneys exchanged brief communications about a causation issue. On August 11, 2022, Aaron Whaley wrote to Sarena Tuttle, asking: “Did we ever get report back on causation? Dr. Barefoot right?” The message was sent from Aaron Whaley at Whaley Law Firm in Louisville, KY, and was addressed to Sarena with a CC to the Keith Graser filevine email.

The following day, August 12, 2022, Sarena Tuttle replied: “Not that I know of. I have not heard anything from Commonwealth in some time and know they had cleared their calendar of availability until September or October. I will reach out to them on this.” Her message confirms no known causation report had been received to that point, notes that Commonwealth had not been in contact and had previously cleared their schedule through September or October, and states she would contact Commonwealth to follow up. The email was sent from Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Her direct line is (502) 365-9435, and her office line is (502) 583-4022. She signed with her email—Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com—and included a note indicating it was her new email address. The message thread shows the correspondence between Sarena and Aaron on those dates, with the CC address KeithGraserWCZ954685@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com included in the Aug. 12 exchange.

The notification noted that the document related to the Medical Report of Dr. Daniel Wolens had been filed for the claim of KEITH BRYAN GRASER on December 12, 2022, and directed the recipients to refer to the LMS system at https://kyworkersclaims.lms.ky.gov/ for more information. The initial email regarding the LMS Claim Document Notification was sent on December 13, 2022 at 13:51:00 -0500 from Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm to Aaron Whaley. In that email, Sarena stated that the report did not specifically list any employees; it merely described “1 or 2 co-workers” and included a list of companies Keith visited: Paul’s Fruit Market, Brooklawn Kitchen, Georgetown ES Windows, and Clariant Doors. In a follow-up message dated December 13, 2022 at 1:36 PM, Sarena asked a clarifying question: “Which employees? Earlier, on December 12, 2022 at 5:01 PM, Aaron Whaley replied with: “I want to depose every employee mentioned in this report.” This exchange occurred after a forwarded message describing the LMS Claim Document Notification, which stated that a document had been filed and that the Medical Report of Dr. Daniel Wolens was associated with the claim number 202200007 for the claimant KEITH BRYAN GRASER, filed on 12/12/2022, with a direct link to LMS for more information and a directive not to reply to the email.

DANIEL WOLENS; Claim Numbers: 202200007; Claimants: KEITH BRYAN GRASER; Date Filed: 12/12/2022. It directed recipients to refer to the LMS claim at https://kyworkersclaims.lms.ky.gov/ for more information and reiterated not to reply to the email. The message was signed by Aaron Whaley of The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and the contact number 502-583-4022. __Keith Graser v Coup Construction - Witness Deposition Scheduling__
From: Sarena Tuttle [sarena@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:sarena@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: "Doug U'Sellis" [DUsellis@umakylaw.com](mailto:DUsellis@umakylaw.com), Rick Neal [rneal@umakylaw.com](mailto:rneal@umakylaw.com), Angie Burns [ABurns@umakylaw.com](mailto:ABurns@umakylaw.com)
CC: Aaron Whaley [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com)
Date: Tue, 13 Dec 2022 14:13:28 -0500

Good afternoon Mr. U'Sellis & Angie,
 Thank you for filing the Report of Dr. Daniel Wolens. In Dr. Wolens'
report he listed several employees in which Mr. Graser had or could have
had contact during the latency period of his illness. Unfortunately, these
employees are not fully identified, only their initials are noted.
 Please disclose the full legal name of each listed Coup Construction
employee noted in Dr. Wolens' report for further investigative purposes up
to and including the intent to schedule the depositions of each said
employee.

Sarena M. Tuttle
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
D: (502) 357-9971
O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104

The message was from Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm to Doug U'Sellis and Angie Burns, with Aaron Whaley copied, and it carried the date and time stamp Tue, December 13, 2022, at 2:13 p.m. Eastern Time (14:13:28 -0500).

In the body of the email, Sarena Tuttle thanked Mr. U'Sellis and Angie Burns for filing the Report of Dr. Daniel Wolens. She noted that Dr. Wolens' report listed several Coup Construction employees with whom Mr. Graser had or could have had contact during the latency period of his illness, but these employees were not fully identified—only their initials were provided. She requested the disclosure of the full legal names of each listed Coup Construction employee identified in Dr. Wolens' report for further investigative purposes, up to and including the intent to schedule depositions of each said employee. The message included Tuttle’s signature block: Sarena M. Tuttle, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Direct: (502) 357-9971; Office: (502) 583-4022 ext. 104; Email: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).

episodes.natural_language:
In the case titled Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020, involving the Estate of Keith Graser as the client, the matter of Keith Graser v Coup Construction concerns scheduling witness depositions for lay witnesses. The communications trace a sequence of emails about identifying witnesses, confirming dates, and obtaining full names from the defendant’s side for investigative purposes and deposition planning.

On December 13, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent a message to Mr. U’Sellis, Doug U’Sellis, Rick Neal, and Angie Burns, with Aaron Whaley copied, regarding the deposition scheduling. She thanked them for filing the Report of Dr. Daniel Wolens. In Dr. Wolens’ report, several Coup Construction employees were listed as having had contact with Mr. Graser during the latency period of his illness, but the employees were not fully identified—only their initials were provided. She requested the disclosure of the full legal names of each listed Coup Construction employee identified in Dr. Wolens’ report for investigative purposes up to and including the intent to schedule the depositions of each said employee.

A little over a week later, on December 22, 2022 at 1:15 PM, Rick Neal replied to Sarena, listing potential witnesses: Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, and Nick Smoke. He stated that he planned to schedule the depositions of the first three individuals, and that Nick Smoke was apparently no longer with the defendant. He added that they would get with her regarding scheduling, but it probably wouldn’t be until after the holidays. His signature identified him as Richard E. Neal of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, located at 100 Mallard Creek Road, Suite 110, Louisville, KY 40207, with a phone number of (502) 736-3600 and a fax number of (502) 736-3606, and included a standard firm tagline about providing Workers Compensation defense in Kentucky and Indiana since 2002. The email also carried a notice that it was created using voice recognition software, with the line: “This email was created using voice recognition software. If you have any questions, Reply to sender or call (502) 736-3600.”

Earlier that same day, at 1:23 PM, Sarena responded to Rick, expressing appreciation and stating that they looked forward to reviewing the dates for availability. She noted that they were pretty open the month of February. Her signature block identified her as Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s Louisville address, and listed both a direct line (D) and main line (O), along with her email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com and the note "(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS)."

Also on December 22, 2022 at 1:34 PM, Angie Burns sent a brief forward or FYI message to Jessica Wiedersatz, though the exact contents beyond “FYI …” were not expanded in the record.

Earlier still, at 1:15 PM on December 22, 2022, Rick Neal had written to Sarena with the same witness list and scheduling intent cited above, reinforcing that depositions would focus on the first three witnesses and noting again that Nick Smoke was no longer with the defendant; he concluded by saying they would coordinate scheduling after the holidays.

On December 28, 2022, at 1:26 PM, Jessica Wiedersatz sent Rick Neal a message: “Rick, Please let me know when you are ready for me to look into dates, etc.” Rick replied at 1:44 PM: “You can go ahead at this point. Thanks.” The signatures for these messages identified Rick Neal as with U’Sellis Mayer & Associates at the same Louisville address, and Jessica Wiedersatz as the sender.

Finally, on January 10, 2023, at 15:40:39 UTC, Jessica Wiedersatz wrote to Sarena, asking for a concrete February date for the lay witness depositions. She stated that providing the witnesses with a specific date would be the easiest way to pin down scheduling, and she asked Sarena to let her know what dates were available.

All of these communications are part of the ongoing exchange among The Whaley Law Firm and U’Sellis Mayer & Associates regarding Keith Graser v Coup Construction, specifically focused on identifying and scheduling depositions for lay witnesses, with February identified as a likely window and with attention to the status of potential witnesses (notably that Nick Smoke is no longer with the defendant). The record also reflects the need to obtain the full legal names of Coup Construction employees listed in Dr. Wolens’ report for further investigative or scheduling purposes. The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details are listed as 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with direct and main phone lines, and the firm’s email address for Sarena Tuttle noted as Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (new email address). The opposing firm, U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, is based at 100 Mallard Creek Road, Suite 110, Louisville, KY 40207.

Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent an email to Doug U’Sellis and Rick Neal (with Aaron Whaley cc’d) requesting that Coup Construction disclose the full legal names of the employees referenced in Dr. Daniel Wolens’ report. Case: Estate of Keith Graser, WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser. Re: Keith Graser v. Coup Construction — Witness Deposition Scheduling.

The communications in this matter began in December 2022 as the firms coordinated the scheduling of lay witness depositions and identified potential witnesses. On December 13, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; telephone numbers and her new email address noted) sent an email to Doug U’Sellis and Rick Neal, with Aaron Whaley cc’d, requesting that Coup Construction disclose the full legal names of the employees listed in Dr. Daniel Wolens’ report. She stated that the information was needed for investigative purposes and to support the intent to schedule depositions of those employees.

A little over a week later, on December 22, 2022, Rick Neal of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates replied, listing potential witnesses: Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, and Nick Smoke, noting that Nick Smoke was apparently no longer with the defendant and that his deposition would not be pursued. Neal said he planned to schedule depositions for the first three individuals and indicated that scheduling would likely occur after the holidays. This message was followed by a December 22, 2022 reply from Sarena Tuttle thanking Neal and stating that the firm was “pretty open the month of February” and would review dates for availability.

Also on December 22, 2022, Angie Burns forwarded the exchange with an “FYI” note. Earlier that day, Sarena’s message to Rick Neal had reiterated the request for full employee identifications from Coup Construction to aid in the investigation and potential deposition planning. In response to the December 22 thread, Rick Neal had provided the list of witnesses and the plan to schedule the depositions after the holidays, and Sarena confirmed February as the open window for scheduling.

On December 28, 2022, Jessica Wiedersatz followed up, asking Rick Neal to let her know when he was ready for her to start looking into dates. Neal replied later that day that she could proceed. He reiterated his earlier list and the plan to schedule depositions after the holidays.

In early January 2023, Jessica Wiedersatz asked again for a concrete February date that Mr. Whaley had open for the lay witness depositions, explaining that providing a specific date to the witnesses would simplify the process. She requested that Neal share what dates were available.

Responding on January 10, 2023, Sarena Tuttle indicated that they were pretty open in February and could schedule depositions on any afternoon during the weeks of February 13 and February 20. She provided her contact details again and reminded that the new email address should be used for future correspondence.

Throughout, the case involved the Estate of Keith Graser as the client and the litigation against Coup Construction, with a focus on scheduling witness depositions and identifying the Coup Construction employees referenced in Dr. Wolens’ report.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser.

In the matter of Keith Graser v. Coup Construction, the estate’s representation—The Whaley Law Firm—began coordinating witness depositions related to the case, designated as Witness Deposition Scheduling. The correspondence spans December 2022 to January 2023 and centers on scheduling lay-witness depositions and identifying the witnesses and potential dates.

On December 13, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, representing the Estate of Keith Graser, emailed Doug U’Sellis, Rick Neal, and Angie Burns, with Aaron Whaley cc’d, to acknowledge the filing of Dr. Daniel Wolens’ report. In that report, Wolens listed several Coup Construction employees with whom Mr. Graser had or could have had contact during the latency period of his illness; however, the employees were identified only by initials. Sarena requested the full legal names of each listed Coup Construction employee referenced in Dr. Wolens’ report for investigative purposes and to enable scheduling depositions of each named employee.

On December 22, 2022, Sarena replied to Rick Neal stating that they were open to scheduling in February and looked forward to reviewing dates for availability. She noted that February would work well for them.

Earlier on December 22, 2022, Rick Neal had indicated in a separate message to Sarena that potential witnesses included Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, and Nick Smoke. He planned to schedule depositions for the first three individuals listed, noting that Nick Smoke was apparently no longer with the defendant. He also suggested that scheduling would likely occur after the holidays.

That same day, December 22, 2022, Rick Neal’s message was followed by a note in the thread from Jessica Wiedersatz asking Rick to let her know when he was ready for her to look into dates and to provide a specific date to the witnesses.

On December 28, 2022, Jessica Wiedersatz again reached out to Rick Neal asking to be advised when she could start looking into deposition dates. In response, Rick Neal replied, “You can go ahead at this point. Thanks.” This affirmed permission to proceed with scheduling.

The thread continued into January 2023. On January 10, 2023, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Jessica Wiedersatz, stating that they were pretty open in February and could do any afternoon during the weeks of February 13 and February 20.

The following day, January 11, 2023, Jessica replied that she was aiming for February 13 at 2:00 PM and had sent an email to the witness to confirm that time, promising to respond as soon as she heard back.

Later on January 11, 2023, at 10:56 AM, Sarena Tuttle replied to Jessica, thanking her for the update and asking for clarification on whether the February 13 date scheduling would cover all three witnesses or just one. In her signature, she again listed The Whaley Law Firm’s contact information and reminded that the email address provided was a new one (Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com).

Throughout these exchanges, the parties discussed open February availability, potential witnesses (including Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, and Nick Smoke, with Nick Smoke noted as no longer with the defendant), the need to identify full names of Coup Construction employees referenced in Dr. Wolens’ report, and the goal of scheduling deposition dates for lay witnesses in the Keith Graser case.

In the Estate of Keith Graser (Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020), the client is the Estate of Keith Graser. The case involved scheduling depositions of lay witnesses in the Keith Graser v Coup Construction matter. The deposition-scheduling discussions unfolded through a chain of emails beginning in December 2022 and continuing into January 2023, involving Jessica Wiedersatz (UmaKy Law), Sarena Tuttle (The Whaley Law Firm), and Rick Neal (U’Sellis Mayer & Associates).

The thread began on December 13, 2022, when Sarena Tuttle sent a request to Doug U’Sellis, Rick Neal, and Angie Burns (cc’ing Aaron Whaley). She asked for the full legal names of each Coup Construction employee listed in Dr. Daniel Wolens’ report because the report identified several employees who had contact with Mr. Graser during the latency period of his illness, but only by initials. The goal was to enable further investigative work and to determine the depositions of each mentioned employee.

A week later, on December 22, 2022, Rick Neal listed potential witnesses as Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, and Nick Smoke. He indicated he planned to schedule depositions for the first three witnesses, noting that Nick Smoke was apparently no longer with the defendant. He also signaled that scheduling would likely occur after the holidays. Later that same day, Sarena Tuttle replied that they were open in February and could accommodate any afternoon during the weeks of February 13 or February 20. The Whaley Law Firm's contact details were provided (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: 502-357-9971; O: 502-583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com), and it was emphasized that this was a new email address.

Meanwhile, on December 28, 2022, Jessica Wiedersatz asked Rick Neal to let her know when he was ready for her to look into dates. Rick had previously indicated readiness to move forward, and Jessica’s message suggested she would begin searching for dates once he confirmed. Angie Burns forwarded a note on December 22, 2022, as a courtesy, and Rick’s earlier message on December 22 to Sarena indicated a plan to review dates for February availability, with Sarena reiterating the February window.

That month’s exchanges continued into late December and early January. On December 28, 2022, Rick Neal replied, “You can go ahead at this point. Thanks.” Jessica followed up again on December 28, 2022, asking to be informed when she should start looking into dates. In separate threads, Angie Burns and Rick Neal kept communications going, with Rick indicating that the depositions would be scheduled after the holidays.

As January 2023 began, Jessica asked for concrete February availability, stating she needed a date for the lay witness depositions. Sarena replied on January 10, 2023, that they were pretty open in February and could do any afternoon during the weeks of February 13 or February 20. Jessica responded on January 10, 2023, at 10:43 AM, expressing that she was aiming for February 13 at 2:00 PM and had already reached out to the witnesses to see if that time would work, promising to revert once she heard back. Sarena followed up on January 11, 2023, at 10:56 AM to clarify whether the proposed date and time would cover all three witnesses or just one, asking to be kept posted. Jessica replied later that day, stating she was aiming for February 13 at 2:00 PM for all three witnesses and that she had contacted the witnesses to confirm; she would provide an update as soon as she heard back.

Finally, on January 12, 2023, at 18:41:06 (UTC), Jessica reiterated the plan to take all three depositions—Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, and Jason Jackman—on February 13, beginning at 2:00 PM. Throughout the thread, the exchanges referenced the depositions of the three witnesses, with Nick Smoke noted as no longer with the defendant, and the depositions were planned for lay witnesses in February, pending witness confirmation. The Whaley Law Firm’s communications continued to reflect the firm’s contact details and the note that Sarena’s email address had changed to sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com. The correspondence includes standard closing lines emphasizing the ongoing coordination for scheduling these depositions in this workers’ compensation defense matter.

Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm regarding the timing and scope of the depositions.

On December 13, 2022, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Doug U’Sellis, Rick Neal, and Angie Burns (with Aaron Whaley copied) requesting the full legal names of each Coup Construction employee listed in Dr. Wolens’ report for investigative purposes, up to and including the deposition of each such employee. The Dr. Wolens report had identified several employees, but only by initials.

Later that same month, on December 22, 2022, Rick Neal informed Jessica Wiedersatz that potential witnesses included Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, and Nick Smoke, noting that he planned to schedule depositions of the first three individuals listed and that Nick Smoke was apparently no longer with the defendant. He suggested coordinating scheduling, likely after the holidays.

Also on December 22, 2022, Sarena Tuttle replied that they looked forward to reviewing dates for availability and that they were pretty open in February.

On December 28, 2022, Jessica asked Rick to let her know when she should begin looking into dates. Rick responded, “You can go ahead at this point. Thanks,” and Jessica followed up accordingly. Rick’s reply and Jessica’s follow-up were part of the ongoing planning.

Earlier, on January 10, 2023, Jessica asked Sarena to provide a date that Mr. Whaley had open in February for the lay witness depositions, noting that providing a specific date to the witnesses would simplify the process. Jessica requested what dates were available.

On January 11, 2023, Sarena replied that they were pretty open in February and asked Jessica to keep them posted about whether the request was for all three witnesses or just one. Jessica responded later that day that she was aiming for February 13 at 2:00 PM and that she had sent an email to the witnesses to confirm whether that works for them, promising to follow up as soon as she heard back.

Also on January 11, 2023, Sarena reiterated her calendar openness for February and provided the Whaley Law Firm’s contact details: Sarena M. Tuttle, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, noting a new email address.

On January 12, 2023, Jessica confirmed to Sarena that she planned to take all three depositions—Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, and Jason Jackman—on February 13, beginning at 2:00 PM. episodes.natural_language:
In the Estate of Keith Graser, case number WC-12-07-2020, the client is the Estate of Keith Graser. The matter concerned scheduling witness depositions in the Keith Graser v Coup Construction dispute. The correspondence spans December 2022 through January 2023 and centers on arranging depositions of lay witnesses identified as potential employer witnesses.

On December 13, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent a request to disclose the full legal names of each Coup Construction employee listed in Dr. Daniel Wolens’ report. In the report, the employees were only identified by initials, and Sarena requested their full names for investigative purposes and future scheduling of the depositions.

A week later, on December 22, 2022, Rick Neal of UMAKYLaw replied that potential witnesses included Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, and Nick Smoke, noting that Nick Smoke was apparently no longer with the defendant. He stated an intention to schedule depositions for the first three individuals and indicated that coordination would likely occur after the holidays.

That same day, December 22, 2022, Sarena responded affirming that they were open to dates in February and asked to review availability. She affirmed openness to the month of February and provided contact context for coordination.

On December 28, 2022, the parties continued to coordinate. Jessica Wiedersatz asked Rick Neal to let her know when he was ready for her to look into dates, so she could propose concrete options. Rick replied that they could proceed and that he would follow up on scheduling. The exchanges also included other participants and reminders that potential witnesses would be Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, with Nick Smoke no longer with the defendant, and that scheduling would likely occur after the holidays.

Further back-and-forth in December 2022 referenced both the need to disclose the full names of Coup Construction employees listed in Dr. Wolens’ report and the plan to schedule depositions of the identified lay witnesses after the holidays, with February as the target window.

Moving into January 2023, Jessica requested a specific February date that Mr. Whaley had open for the lay witness depositions, noting that providing a concrete date would make it easier to coordinate with the witnesses. Sarena asked for clarification on whether the February date would cover all three witnesses or just one, and Jessica responded that she was aiming to take all three depositions—Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, and Jason Jackman—on February 13, 2023, beginning at 2:00 PM, and that she had already contacted the witnesses to confirm.

Sarena acknowledged Jessica’s plan on January 12, 2023, writing, “Awesome. Thank you for the clarification, just wanted to make sure I have it noted properly.” She included her standard firm contact details and noted the address for The Whaley Law Firm in Louisville, KY, along with D (direct) and O (office) numbers and her email (Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com), while also reminding that this is a new email address.

The next day, January 20, 2023, Jessica advised that she had finally gathered all of the employer witnesses and prepared the deposition notice. She asked Sarena to let her know if anything else was needed. In response, on January 20, 2023 at 2:13 PM, Sarena replied, “That’s awesome. Thank you so much Jessica, I know that was not an easy task.” Her signature then included The Whaley Law Firm's contact details and again noted the new email address.

In summary, the parties worked through December 2022 to January 2023 to identify the appropriate lay witnesses (Nick Hyde, Eric Burkstom, Jason Jackman, with Nick Smoke no longer with the defendant), confirm February availability, and schedule three depositions to take place on February 13, 2023, beginning at 2:00 PM. A deposition notice for these witnesses was prepared and circulated as of January 20, 2023.

__Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction__
From: Aaron Whaley [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: [dusellis@umakylaw.com](mailto:dusellis@umakylaw.com), [keithgraserwcz954685@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:keithgraserwcz954685@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com) Estate of Keith Graser WC 12/07/2020
Cc: [sarena@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:sarena@whaleylawfirm.com) Sarena Tuttle
Date: Thu, 4 May 2023 10:12:07 -0400

Doug, I hope this email finds you well. I have attached what I received
from PNC on Keith Graser's checking account. The account statements run
from September to December. You can see charges each month to Walmart,
Walgreens, Kroger, Costco etc. I have spoken to Mrs. Graser and she relates
that she would use the card in those places and made the charges. The two
of them did not have a joint account and one of the ways they had split the
bills was that Keith was responsible for groceries. Since Keith was not
receiving income at this time you can also see Zel deposits from Mrs.
Graser into Keith's account. This was just so they could keep track of the
separate charges. I can provide you with an affidavit from Mrs. Graser or
if you like we can schedule a follow up deposition.

I have reviewed the previous depositions in this matter and while there are
some other employees that I could depose I don't think that is necessary.
There are some items from the deposition that I would like to get from
Coupe that were mentioned in the deposition. I would like a list of all
employees that would have been in the office at Coupe during the week Keith
was working. It was mentioned that as many as 8 different office staff
could have been there. It was mentioned in Eric Bergstrom's deposition that
Keith may have worked with someone on the Paul's Fruit market job. I would
like to have all records of who worked on the Paul's Fruit Market Job. I
would like to have any record of staff quarantined after Keith's Covid
Diagnosis. I can file a formal Interrogatory on this if you like.

Doug, any interest in discussing a resolution to this case? Thanks.

-- 
Aaron Whaley
Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Ln
Louisville, KY 40222
502-583-4022
episodes.natural_language:
This narrative concerns the Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020), with the client listed as the Estate of Keith Graser.

On May 4, 2023, Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm sent an email to Doug Dusellis and others regarding Keith Graser’s finances. He attached bank statements from PNC for Keith Graser’s checking account, covering September through December. The statements show monthly charges at Walmart, Walgreens, Kroger, Costco, and similar retailers. Whaley reported that he spoke with Mrs. Graser, who stated that she would use the card for those purchases and that she made the charges. The note explains that the couple did not have a joint account, and Keith was not receiving income at that time; accordingly, Zel deposits from Mrs. Graser into Keith’s account were made so they could track the separate charges. Whaley offered to provide an affidavit from Mrs. Graser or to schedule a follow-up deposition if desired.

Whaley also stated that he has reviewed the prior depositions in this matter and that, while there are other employees who could be deposed, he does not think that is necessary at this time. He identified several discovery items from the deposition that he would like to obtain from Coupe Construction. Specifically, he seeks a list of all employees who would have been in Coupe’s office during the week Keith was working, noting that as many as eight different office staff could have been present. He also noted in Eric Bergstrom’s deposition that Keith may have worked with someone on the Paul’s Fruit Market job, and he would like to obtain all records of who worked on that project. Additionally, he requests any records of staff quarantined after Keith’s Covid diagnosis, and he offered to file a formal Interrogatory on this issue if desired. He closed by asking whether there is any interest in discussing a resolution to the case.

Doug, any interest in discussing a resolution to this case? Thanks.

Aaron Whaley
Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Ln
Louisville, KY 40222
502-583-4022
episodes.author: Aaron Whaley

__Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007)__
From: Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: [dusellis@umakylaw.com](mailto:dusellis@umakylaw.com)
Date: Fri, 30 Jun 2023 12:57:08 -0400

Good morning Doug, 

 

 

 

I am reaching out in hopes of obtaining an amicable resolution of this claim, and as such, tender the following demand:

 

 

Although there is no AWW-1 currently filed, Mr. Graser?s Average Weekly Wage should by all accounts be calculated as $1,110.00. This is the amount he was paid in December 2020 while he was off work due to his illness. The applicable state AWW for the same period was $890.00 which would provide a weekly benefit to Mr. Graser?s widow of $445.00. Mr. Graser?s birthdate was July 7, 1958. This means from the date of the death, weekly benefits would be paid to my client?s widow for approximately 7.5 years (390 weeks) at the rate identified above. These weekly benefits over that period of time equate to $173,550.00. 

 

Further, the KRS 342.750(6) lump sum death benefit amount on December 7, 2020 (the first date off work from COVID) was $87,421.45. 

 

Thus, at this time, our demand for full and final settlement of this claim is $260,971.45. 

 

 

Thank you for your consideration in this regard and I hope to hear from you soon. 

 

 

 

 

 

W. Bryce Koon, Esq.The Whaley Law Firm 712 Lyndon Lane

Louisville, KY 40222Phone: (502) 365-5043Fax: (502) 237-3207

 

This electronic message is intended only for the named recipient. It may contain attorney-client privileged r otherwise protected information. If you have received this message or any attachment in error, you are instructed to contact The Whaley Law Firm and advise in this regard, no waiver of any privilege shall be applicable, and you are instructed that you should not use the information contained herein or forward it to any third person not intended to receive it.
episodes.natural_language:
In the workers’ compensation matter labeled Estate of Keith Graser, WC 12-07-2020, the client is the Estate of Keith Graser. In the case Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (case number 2022-00007), on June 30, 2023, at 12:57:08 p.m. Eastern Time, Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Doug Dusellis at umakylaw.com with the message.

The email opens with a request for an amicable resolution of the claim and a formal demand. Although no AWW-1 has been filed, the sender contends that Mr. Graser’s Average Weekly Wage should be calculated at $1,110.00, reflecting the amount he was paid in December 2020 while he was off work due to illness. The applicable state AWW for the same period is $890.00, which would yield a weekly benefit to Mr. Graser’s widow of $445.00. Mr. Graser was born on July 7, 1958. Based on his death date, weekly benefits would be paid to the widow for approximately 7.5 years (390 weeks) at the $445.00 per week rate, totaling $173,550.00.

The message also notes that the lump-sum death benefit under KRS 342.750(6), on December 7, 2020—the first date off work due to COVID—was $87,421.45. Taken together, the demand for a full and final settlement at this time amounts to $260,971.45.

The communication closes with thanks for consideration and an expression of hope to hear back soon. The sender’s signature block identifies W. Bryce Koon, Esq., The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with a phone number of (502) 365-5043 and a fax number of (502) 237-3207.

The message also includes the standard attorney-client disclaimer: This electronic message is intended only for the named recipient. It may contain attorney-client privileged or otherwise protected information. If you have received this message or any attachment in error, you are instructed to contact The Whaley Law Firm and advise in this regard; no waiver of any privilege shall be applicable, and you are instructed that you should not use the information contained herein or forward it to any third person not intended to receive it.

From: Rick NealSent: Thursday, October 5, 2023 5:52 PMTo: Bryce Koon; Doug U'SellisSubject: RE: Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (Claim No. 2022-00007)

 

Hi Bryce,

 

Just a quick informal response to the supplemental RFPD.  

 

With regards to the interrogatories, I am almost certain that they are allowable in in WC proceeding, but I will double check the law in that area.  That said, I have provided the names requested in Interrogatory NO 1 below as a request a part of REQUEST NO 3.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser. This summary covers discovery communications in the matter Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (Claim No. 2022-00007), arising from the Estate of Keith Graser and Coupe Construction. The correspondence involved The Whaley Law Firm, counsel for the plaintiff, and U­Makel Mayer & Associates, counsel for the defense, with participation by individuals including Bryce Koon, Aaron Whaley, Rick Neal, Doug U’Sellis, and Cody James, among others.

On August 30, 2023, Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Doug U’Sellis and Rick Neal regarding Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (Claim No. 2022-00007). The message stated that discovery requests and the associated notice were attached and was directed with Aaron Whaley copied on the message. The email carried the standard privilege disclaimer indicating it was intended only for the named recipient and that it may contain attorney-client privileged or protected information; recipients were instructed not to use or forward the material if received in error. The August 30 message was authored with the signature of W. Bryce Koon, Esq., and included the firm’s contact details.

A follow-up inquiry was sent on October 2, 2023. In that message, Bryce Koon again addressed Doug U’Sellis and Rick Neal, requesting an update on the status of the discovery requests. The message included a standard attorney-client privilege disclaimer similar to the August 30 email and was signed by Bryce Koon, Esq., with the Whaley Law Firm’s contact information.

On October 5, 2023, Rick Neal, replying on behalf of Umaky Mayer & Associates, provided an informal response to the supplemental Request for Production of Documents (RFPD). He indicated that he was almost certain interrogatories are permissible in a workers’ compensation proceeding but would double-check the applicable law. He explained that the names requested in Interrogatory No. 1 were provided as part of Request No. 3. He also noted that the information for the RFPD came from Cody James, who is the financial controller. The responses were:

- Request No. 1: Please provide all Ledger Card Reports in the Defendant’s possession regarding every employee and job for the work performed by Coupe Construction during the period from November 1, 2020, to December 15, 2020. Answer: See attached Ledger Card reports by employee and by job for the requested date range.

- Request No. 2: Please provide a list of all Coupe Construction employees and their job descriptions for anyone who worked for Coupe Construction during the period from November 1, 2020, to December 15, 2020. Answer: See attached employee list.

- Request No. 3: Please provide any and all documents identifying individuals who were quarantined or otherwise restricted from work at Coupe Construction during the period from November 1, 2020, to December 15, 2020. Answer: Nick Snoke, Nick Hyde, and Jason Jackman were quarantined or restricted. There is no documentation related to these quarantines.

- Request No. 4: Please provide any and all payroll records for all Coupe Construction employees for the period from November 1, 2020, to December 15, 2020. Answer: See the attached ledger cards that were attached for Request No. 1, which should be all relevant payroll information.

In closing, Rick Neal thanked the recipients for their patience and invited any questions. His contact details included his name, law firm, address (100 Mallard Creek Road, Suite 110, Louisville, KY 40207), phone and fax numbers (Phone: 502-736-3600; Fax: 502-736-3606), and the firm’s website (www.umakylaw.com) along with his email address (rneal@umakylaw.com). He also noted that the firm has provided workers’ compensation defense services in Kentucky and Indiana since 2002. A note at the end of the email stated that the message was created using voice recognition software, with instructions to reply to the sender or call the provided number if there were questions.

The chain of communications also includes an October 6, 2023 forwarding by Bryce Koon of the Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (Claim No. 2022-00007) with the subject line reflecting the same case. The forward was directed to Aaron Whaley and cc’d to KeithGraserWCZ954685@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, indicating continued discussion of the discovery requests and related matters.

To summarize the substantive details preserved in these communications:
- The subject case is Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction, Claim No. 2022-00007, with the client being the Estate of Keith Graser.
- Discovery requests were issued on or before August 30, 2023, and followed up on October 2, 2023.
- The defense provided responses to four requests for production and information on October 5, 2023, noting that the material came from Cody James (the Financial Controller) and addressing the status of Interrogatories (noting potential WC propriety and that Interrogatory No. 1’s names would be included as part of Request No. 3).
- The responses included attachments: ledger cards by employee and by job, an attached employee list, a note identifying three individuals who were quarantined or restricted (Nick Snoke, Nick Hyde, Jason Jackman) with a statement that there was no documentation related to these quarantines, and payroll information accompanying the ledger cards.
- The communications were accompanied by standard privilege and confidentiality disclaimers, as well as a voice-recognition software notice in Rick Neal’s October 5 email.

Chronology of discovery communications

On October 23, 2023, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, sent a message to counsel for the defense—Rick Neal of Umaki Law & Associates and Doug U’Sellis—cc’ing KeithGraserWCZ954685@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com. The subject was Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007). In the body of the email, Koon stated, “Good afternoon counsel, Please see the attached requests. The associated notice was filed today via LMS.” The email carried The Whaley Law Firm’s standard confidentiality disclaimer, noting that the electronic message is intended only for the named recipient and may contain attorney-client privileged or otherwise protected information; if received in error, the recipient should contact The Whaley Law Firm and not use or forward the information.

On November 3, 2023, at 2:10 PM, Rick Neal replied to Bryce Koon and Doug U’Sellis, cc’ing Aaron Whaley. Neal wrote that he had written the employer and requested the information that had been asked for in the interrogatories, but that the document request appeared very broad. He asked whether the request could be narrowed and whether the documents sought were essentially limited to anything related to COVID or COVID exposure. Neal signed as Richard E. Neal of U-Sellis Mayer & Associates, with the firm’s address at 100 Mallard Creek Road, Suite 110, Louisville, KY 40207, and included the firm’s website and contact information. He also noted that the email was generated using voice recognition software and reminded recipients of the confidentiality standards.

On November 10, 2023, Bryce Koon responded: “Good afternoon counsel, Just wanted to follow up and see if you had gotten responses back from the employer to our Interrogatories. Regarding the document requests, we are essentially looking for any documents from the period of November 1, 2020 to December 15, 2020 (such as job reports, time cards, payroll records, schedules, etc.) relating to any individuals identified in Interrogatory 1. Hope this helps clarify some things. If you need for me to amend or issue a more specific RFPD in this regard, I am happy to do so.” The email again carried the same confidentiality notice and was signed by W. Bryce Koon, Esq., The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s Louisville address and phone/fax numbers, and the standard protective disclaimer.

Finally, on December 6, 2023, at 11:50:43 a.m. Eastern Time (as indicated by the -0500 time zone), Bryce Koon sent a follow-up message beginning, “Good morning counsel, I just wanted to follow up on this one. Any update would be greatly appreciated.” The message included Koon’s contact details for The Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; phone: 502-365-5043; fax: 502-237-3207) and again carried the confidentiality and privilege notices advising that the message is intended only for the named recipient and may contain attorney-client privileged or protected information; recipients are instructed not to use or forward the contents if the message was received in error.

Across all messages, the subject line consistently referenced Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007). The communications centered on discovery-related items, including attached discovery requests filed via LMS on October 23, 2023, and a discussion of interrogatories and related document production requests. The document requests were described as pertaining to documents from November 1, 2020 to December 15, 2020, including items such as job reports, time cards, payroll records, and schedules, and they were to relate to individuals identified in Interrogatory 1. The parties considered whether the requests should be narrowed, and Bryce Koon offered to amend or issue a more specific Request for Production of Documents (RFPD) if needed.

This summary reflects the full thread of communications dated October 23, 2023; November 3, 2023; November 10, 2023; and December 6, 2023, including the confidentiality and privilege notices embedded in each message.

From: Jessica Wiedersatz [jwiedersatz@umakylaw.com](mailto:jwiedersatz@umakylaw.com)
To: via [sarena@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:sarena@whaleylawfirm.com)

Date: Mon, 18 Dec 2023 19:55:54 +0000

Estate of Keith Graser, the client in the workers’ compensation case Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020 against Coupe Construction, sought an updated deposition of Nancy Graser in the Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction matter. The correspondence centers on scheduling that deposition and deciding where it would take place.

On December 18, 2023, Jessica Wiedersatz of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates emailed Sarena Tuttle requesting an updated deposition of Ms. Graser. Jessica noted that her firm would like to depose Ms. Graser and asked whether the deposition should occur at U’Sellis Mayer & Associates’ office or at The Whaley Law Firm’s office. She mentioned that U’Sellis Mayer & Associates had recently moved to the St. Matthews area, near the St. Matthews Mall, and she listed available start times of 10:00 a.m. or 2:00 p.m., with flexibility on the start time. The dates Jessica provided were January 12, January 17, January 19, and January 22. She asked to confirm which date and time would work and asked what time would be suitable for Mr. Whaley. The email signature identified Jessica as a Paralegal at U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, with the firm’s address at 100 Mallard Creek Road, Suite 110, Louisville, KY 40207, and provided phone and fax numbers, along with the firm’s website and email address jwiedersatz@umakylaw.com. She also included a note that the firm provides workers’ compensation defense throughout Kentucky and Indiana since 2002, and the email contained a small image reference.

Later that same day, December 18, 2023, at approximately 3:02 p.m., Sarena Tuttle replied to Jessica. In her response, Sarena stated that she would check in with Aaron Whaley and would update Jessica as soon as possible. Sarena’s signature confirmed her title as Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s address, phone numbers, email (noting a new address), and other contact details.

The following day, December 19, 2023, at 10:57:21 a.m. Eastern Time, Sarena sent another email to Jessica. In this message, Sarena stated that The Whaley Law Firm’s office was available on January 17, 2024, starting at 10:00 a.m. via Zoom. She added that they could also conduct the deposition at Jessica’s office, “especially since you guys are right around the corner now.” The email reiterated that Jessica’s firm had moved to the St. Matthews area and was near the St. Matthews Mall.

The original email thread included Jessica’s earlier note that the deposition had previously been held in their office, and she asked for preference on location (Whaley’s office or U’Sellis Mayer & Associates’ office). The dates proposed by Jessica were 1/12, 1/17, 1/19, and 1/22, with a preference for start times of 10:00 a.m. or 2:00 p.m., and she requested to know what time would work for Mr. Whaley. The chain of communication was CC’d to Aaron Whaley and Bryce Koon of The Whaley Law Firm.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser. Re: Updated Deposition of Nancy Graser re Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction.

In December 2023, the Whaley Law Firm and U’Sellis Mayer & Associates coordinated an updated deposition of Nancy Graser in the matter Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction. The matter is identified as Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020, with the client being the Estate of Keith Graser.

The exchange began with an email from Jessica Wiedersatz of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates to Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, dated December 18, 2023 at 2:55 PM. Jessica stated that they would like to take an updated deposition of Ms. Graser and noted that, while previous depositions were held in the defense office, they were flexible about location this time, offering to hold the deposition either at the defense office or at Whaley’s office, which had recently relocated to the St. Matthews area near the St. Matthews mall. She provided a list of dates—January 12, January 17, January 19, and January 22—with a suggested start time of either 10:00 AM or 2:00 PM, and she asked to confirm what would work for Mr. Whaley.

Sarena responded the same day, December 18, 2023, at 3:02 PM, indicating that she would check with Aaron and would update Jessica as soon as possible. In her note, she also reiterated the firm’s contact information and the new email address for Sarena: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Direct line 502-357-9971; Office line 502-583-4022 ext. 104; Email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting the new address).

Later, on December 19, 2023, at 10:57 AM, Sarena replied that their office was available on January 17, 2024 starting at 10:00 AM via Zoom, though they could also conduct the deposition at the opposing office if preferred, acknowledging that the opposing side was nearby in the St. Matthews area. She again provided her signature block with the Whaley Law Firm contact details and the reminder of the new email address.

That same day, December 19, 2023, at 11:20 AM, Jessica replied that Zoom would be acceptable for the updated deposition. She stated that she had scheduled the deposition for January 17, 2024 at 10:00 AM and attached the notice. She explained that the Zoom link information was included in the notice and also provided the Zoom link directly: https://us06web.zoom.us/j/87663326396, with Meeting ID 876 6332 6396 and no passcode required.

In a follow-up email, dated December 19, 2023 at 12:52 PM, Sarena thanked Jessica and said she would forward the information to Mrs. Graser. She reiterated that the deposition was set for January 17, 2024 at 10:00 AM via Zoom and reiterated the Zoom link details as provided in Jessica’s notice. Sarena closed with her standard contact information, including her name, title (Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager), the firm’s address, direct and office phone numbers, and her email address (noting the new address).

Additional context from the chain shows Jessica’s earlier note that the defense team had moved to the St. Matthews area and that initial availability included January 12, January 17, January 19, and January 22, with potential start times of 10:00 AM or 2:00 PM, though she indicated flexibility and asked what would work for Mr. Whaley. She also confirmed that the deposition had previously been held in the defense office and sought to determine whether the current deposition would occur at the defense office or at Whaley’s office.

Summary of key details preserved:
- Case: Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction, WC-12-07-2020.
- Client: Estate of Keith Graser.
- The deposition concerned: Updated deposition of Nancy Graser.
- Scheduling was coordinated December 18–19, 2023, with proposed dates including 1/12, 1/17, 1/19, 1/22; preferred start times 10:00 AM or 2:00 PM; location options included the defense office or Whaley’s office near St. Matthews.
- Final arrangement: Deposition set for January 17, 2024 at 10:00 AM Eastern via Zoom.
- Zoom details: Join link https://us06web.zoom.us/j/87663326396; Meeting ID 876 6332 6396; No passcode required.
- Notices and communications were exchanged among Sarena Tuttle (Whaley Law Firm) and Jessica Wiedersatz (U’Sellis Mayer & Associates), with CCs to Aaron Whaley and Bryce Koon.
- The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details and Sarena’s new email address were included in the communications.

Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser.

Re: Updated Deposition of Nancy Graser re Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction. This correspondence summarizes a series of emails between The Whaley Law Firm, representing the Estate of Keith Graser, and U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, regarding an updated deposition of Nancy Graser in the case against Coupe Construction.

On December 18, 2023, Jessica Wiedersatz of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates wrote to Sarena Tuttle at The Whaley Law Firm that they would like to take an updated deposition of Ms. Graser. They noted that last time the deposition was held in their office and asked whether the deposition should be held in Whaley’s office or in U’Sellis Mayer’s office, mentioning that U’Sellis Mayer had moved to the St. Matthews area near the St. Matthews Mall. They proposed several dates for the deposition: January 12, January 17, January 19, and January 22, with start times of 10:00 AM or 2:00 PM, expressing flexibility and asking Sarena to indicate what would work for Mr. Whaley.

Later on December 18, 2023 at 3:02 PM, Sarena Tuttle replied that she would check with Aaron on the matter and update Jessica as soon as possible. Her signature identified her as Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with direct line (502) 357-9971, office line (502) 583-4022 ext. 104, and email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting a new email address).

On December 19, 2023 at 10:57 AM, Sarena followed up from The Whaley Law Firm, stating that their office is available on January 17, 2024 starting at 10:00 AM via Zoom, and that they could also hold the deposition at U’Sellis Mayer’s office since they are nearby. Her contact details were included again in this message.

Also on December 19, 2023 at 11:21 AM, Jessica replied that Zoom would be fine for the updated deposition. She stated that she had set the deposition for January 17, 2024 at 10:00 AM and attached the notice. She noted that the Zoom link information was on the notice and provided the Zoom link below, along with the meeting details: “ZOOM LINK,” and the meeting information for “Depo/Nancy Graser re Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction.” The Zoom join link was https://us06web.zoom.us/j/87663326396, with Meeting ID 876 6332 6396 and no passcode required. She invited further communication if anything else was needed.

The preceding messages also included a prior exchange dated December 19, 2023 at 10:57 AM, when Sarena stated that the office was available for the January 17, 2024 deposition starting at 10:00 AM via Zoom, reiterating flexibility about location since U’Sellis Mayer & Associates is nearby.

On January 3, 2024, at 2:31 PM (the timestamp appears as 2:31?PM in the record), Jessica wrote that Doug requested a slight postponement of Ms. Graser’s January 17, 2024 deposition to allow time to obtain documents via subpoena duces tecum. Jessica asked whether any of the following dates would work: January 30, January 31, February 1, or February 2, with a start time of either 10:00 AM or 2:00 PM Eastern. She noted flexibility with the start time and invited Sarena to call to confirm the preferred start time.

Finally, on January 4, 2024, at 11:22 AM, Sarena responded that the only date that works for their office is January 30, 2024, with a start time of 10:00 AM via Zoom. Her message included the same contact details and again emphasized the new email address: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser.

This note documents the sequence of communications about an updated deposition of Nancy Graser in the matter of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction. The exchange primarily occurred between Jessica Wiedersatz, a paralegal at U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, and Sarena Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, with ongoing involvement from Doug Whaley.

The earliest dated thread begins with Jessica’s December 18, 2023 message. She outlined the desire to conduct an updated deposition of Ms. Graser and noted that the deposition had been held previously in their office. Jessica asked whether they preferred to hold the deposition at Whaley’s office or at U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, which had moved to the St. Matthews area near the St. Matthews mall. She proposed several dates—January 12, January 17, January 19, and January 22—with start times of 10:00 a.m. or 2:00 p.m., and asked for Mr. Whaley’s preferred start time.

Later that same day, December 18, 2023 at 3:02 p.m., Sarena replied that she would check with Aaron and provide an update as soon as possible.

On December 19, 2023 at 10:57 a.m., Sarena informed Jessica that their office was available for an updated deposition on January 17, 2024, starting at 10:00 a.m. via Zoom, though they could also accommodate a deposition at Whaley’s office, given that Jessica’s office was nearby. She provided her contact details and noted the new email address.

Shortly thereafter, at 11:21 a.m. on December 19, 2023, Jessica responded that, for an updated deposition, Zoom would be fine. She had set the deposition for January 17, 2024 at 10:00 a.m. and attached the notice. The Zoom link information was included in the notice, and she provided the link directly: Zoom meeting for “Depo/Nancy Graser re Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction,” scheduled for January 17, 2024 at 10:00 a.m. Eastern Time. The join link was https://us06web.zoom.us/j/87663326396, with Meeting ID 876 6332 6396 and no passcode required.

On January 3, 2024, at approximately 2:31 p.m. (the time is shown as 2:31?PM in the record), Jessica proposed pushing Ms. Graser’s January 17, 2024 deposition out a bit to allow time to obtain documents via subpoena duces tecum. She asked which of the following dates would work: January 30, January 31, February 1, or February 2, and noted that start times of 10:00 a.m. or 2:00 p.m. Eastern were acceptable, though they were flexible.

The following day, January 4, 2024, at 11:23 a.m., Sarena responded that the only date that works for their office is January 30, 2024, with a start time of 10:00 a.m. via Zoom. She also noted the continued use of the same Zoom link as before and included her signature, which now indicates the new email address for contact.

In the same thread, at 4:45:40 p.m. on January 4, 2024, Jessica acknowledged and stated that she had attached the amended notice and that the Zoom link would remain the same as before.

The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details were cited in the messages: Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line (502) 357-9971; office line (502) 583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com; with a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.” These details also appear in the signatures within the exchanges.

In summary, the deposition planning evolved from an initial set of possible dates in mid-January (with a preference for a 10:00 a.m. or 2:00 p.m. start and the option to hold the deposition at either office) to a narrowed arrangement centered on January 17, 2024 via Zoom. That plan was subsequently revised due to the need to obtain subpoenaed documents, shifting the available date window to late January or early February, with January 30, 2024 at 10:00 a.m. via Zoom being the date that Whaley’s office could accommodate. The existing amended notice and Zoom link remained in effect, and the parties continued to coordinate through Jessica and Sarena, with the case details remaining tied to the Estate of Keith Graser in the matter of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction.
