episodes.natural_language:
In the case Estate of Keith Graser (Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020), involving Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007), the Whaley Law Firm and UMAK Law were coordinating discovery and the scheduling of a deposition in February 2024. On February 6, 2024, Jessica Wiedersatz of UMAK Law informed Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, that a subpoena duces tecum had been sent to Discover Financial Services to obtain account information. Discover indicated they could not meet the subpoena’s February 26, 2024 deadline and expected to respond by March 28, 2024. Jessica noted that, given the BRC (Benefit Review Conference) was set for March 27, 2024, she hoped to receive the records before the end of March and asked whether Ms. Graser’s deposition could be rescheduled to a date about a week before the BRC, providing potential dates and inviting confirmation of availability.

Sarena responded in early February, indicating that 2/28 or 2/29 would work for the deposition. She later confirmed that a start time of 10:00 AM would be fine and asked that it be noted on their calendar. On February 13, Jessica proposed moving Ms. Graser’s deposition to February 29 at 10:00 AM, if still available, and Sarena acknowledged, with confirmation that 10:00 AM would be acceptable. On February 14, Jessica again confirmed the 10:00 AM time and sent a deposition notice for Ms. Graser. She also attached a copy of the notice and, later that day, provided a corrected Zoom link for the deposition.

The deposition notice was for Depo/Nancy Graser re Keith Graser, scheduled for February 29, 2024 at 10:00 AM Eastern Time, with Join Zoom Meeting at https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84513117701 and Meeting ID 845 1311 7701. The notice indicated the matter and the Zoom parameters, and Jessica had attached the notice for the file. The Zoom invitation was titled “U'Sellis Mayer & Associates – Zoom 2 is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting,” and the subject referenced was the deposition of Nancy Graser in the Keith Graser case.

By February 23, 2024, Jessica reiterated that Discover had not yet provided the requested account information, confirming the February 26 due date and stating that Discover would likely respond by March 28, 2024. She noted that the BRC remained scheduled for March 27, 2024 and asked whether Ms. Graser’s deposition could be moved to a date about a week before the BRC, listing open dates as 3/18, 3/19, 3/20, and 3/21, and inviting confirmation of which date would work and the preferred start time.

On February 26, 2024, Sarena replied that the deposition could be moved to March 21, 2024. This final arrangement superseded the prior February 29, 2024 deposition date, aligning the deposition with the calendar constraints and the anticipated timing of Discover’s production. Throughout, Sarena’s signature reflected her role and contact information at The Whaley Law Firm: Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting the new email address).

episodes.natural_language:
This note concerns the case Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020, with the client being the Estate of Keith Graser, and the matter captioned Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007). The communications span late February and March 2024 and revolve around scheduling Ms. Graser’s deposition and handling subpoenas to Discover Financial Services, including Zoom logistics and calendar constraints.

On February 6, 2024, Jessica Wiedersatz of U’Sellis Mayer & Associates reported to Lisa C. Chaffin (Education & Labor Cabinet, Department of Workers’ Claims) and to Sarena Tuttle that they had sent a subpoena duces tecum to Discover Financial Services. The subpoena had previously been signed by Judge O’Bryan, but Discover denied the request because it had not been sent to the correct address. An updated subpoena duces tecum with the correct Discover address was attached, and Jessica asked that Judge O’Bryan sign the updated subpoena so they could again attempt to obtain records from Discover. Jessica cc’d Mr. Graser’s attorney’s office on this communication. The message also included the confidentiality notice typical of such correspondence.

Earlier, Jessica had also attached the signed subpoena and the deposition notice to Discover as part of attempting to obtain the requested records, noting that this was done in an effort to obtain discovery and that they did not plan to depose at that time. In subsequent correspondence, Lisa Chaffin confirmed receipt of the subpoena.

By February 8, 2024, Jessica stated that they were still awaiting subpoenaed documents from Discover, with the due date on the subpoena set for February 26, 2024. She explained a desire to have Discover’s documents before taking Ms. Graser’s deposition and proposed scheduling Ms. Graser’s deposition before March 8, 2024, to accommodate calendar constraints. Jessica offered several potential dates, specifically February 28, February 29, March 1, and March 4 (morning only), with start times of 10:00 AM or 2:00 PM, and asked for confirmation of what would work for Mr. Whaley and Mr. Koon.

In a sequence of messages beginning February 12 and continuing February 14, 2024, Sarena Tuttle responded that the 28th or 29th would work for deposition dates, and Jessica confirmed that a 10:00 AM start would be fine and that she would note it on the calendar. On February 14, 2024, Jessica also advised that she had sent a notice earlier that day but had to change the Zoom link for Ms. Graser’s deposition, asking Sarena to discard the earlier notice and use the attached notice with the correct Zoom link. The attachment described the following Zoom details: Depo/Nancy Graser re Keith Graser, scheduled for February 29, 2024, at 10:00 AM Eastern Time, with the Zoom link https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84513117701 and Meeting ID 845 1311 7701. Jessica labeled the previous link as needing replacement and provided the correct Zoom link information.

On February 14, 2024, Sarena replied that 10:00 AM would be fine and that she would note the time on the calendar.

By February 23, 2024, Jessica reported that Discover had responded to the subpoena request earlier that morning but could not meet the February 26, 2024 deadline. Discover anticipated a response by March 28, 2024. Jessica noted that the contested deposition should be scheduled for a date roughly a week before the Firm’s Case Readiness Conference (BRC), which was set for March 27, 2024. She inquired whether Ms. Graser’s deposition could be scheduled on dates including March 18, 19, 20, or 21, and asked for confirmation of which dates would work for opposing counsel. She also invited Sarena to call to confirm the start time.

On February 26, 2024, Jessica confirmed that she had left the requested start time at 10:00 AM and attached the amended notice. She explained that the Zoom link information was on the notice, and she provided the same Zoom link as before (https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84513117701) with Meeting ID 845 1311 7701. Jessica indicated that the deposition notice had been amended accordingly and requested confirmation of any needed adjustments. Later that same day, Sarena Tuttle responded that the deposition in Ms. Graser’s case could be moved to March 21, 2024.

Sarena’s signature appeared at the end of her messages, identifying her as a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s Louisville, Kentucky office address and contact numbers. Jessica’s communications included her role as a paralegal and her reference to U’Sellis Mayer & Associates, including an embedded Zoom link for the deposition.

In summary, the case file records a series of scheduling efforts for Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007) by the Estate of Keith Graser, including: (1) attempts to obtain records from Discover via subpoena duces tecum, with Discover citing an address issue and a projected response date of March 28, 2024 and a BRC date of March 27, 2024; (2) proposed deposition dates around late February to early March 2024, with a preferred start time of 10:00 AM and alternative 2:00 PM slots, contingent on Discover’s production and counsel availability; (3) adjustments to Zoom meeting logistics, including a corrected Zoom link for the deposition originally scheduled for February 29, 2024 at 10:00 AM Eastern, and a consistently used link (Meeting ID 845 1311 7701) for the deposition; and (4) a final decision to move Ms. Graser’s deposition to March 21, 2024.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020, representing the Estate of Keith Graser.

The matter cited is Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction, case number 2022-00007. The client is the Estate of Keith Graser. On February 27, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm in Louisville, Kentucky, sent a message to Jessica Wiedersatz of UMAK Law (with Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon copied) explaining that Mrs. Graser’s deposition would have to be cancelled for that date. Mrs. Graser has a doctor appointment on March 21, 2024 that cannot be rescheduled within a reasonable time frame. As a result, they proposed either rescheduling for March 26, 2024, or proceeding with the deposition after the BRC, with the attorneys able to inform the Administrative Law Judge that they had been awaiting a response from Discover.

The message also included contact details for Sarena Tuttle and noted a new email address for her. Specifically, her signature listed The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with direct line (502) 357-9971, office line (502) 583-4022 ext 104, and email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

Earlier into the scheduling process, on February 26, 2024, Sarena indicated she would update Mrs. Graser. Jessica Wiedersatz replied that the start time would remain 10:00 AM, but she asked to be notified if adjustments were needed and attached an amended deposition notice. Jessica also provided the Zoom link information, stating it remained the same as the previously planned link. The link was listed as https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84513117701 with Meeting ID 845 1311 7701. The communications at that time also indicated that the deposition notice contained the Zoom link and related details.

In the preceding exchanges, Jessica had confirmed her preference to move Ms. Graser’s deposition to a date before the settlement conference or “BRC” (the BRC being scheduled for March 27, 2024). They discussed several potential dates while Discover subpoenaed documents; the subpoena to Discover requested account information with a due date of February 26, 2024. Discover advised that they could not meet the February 26 deadline and anticipated responding by March 28, 2024. The parties hoped to obtain Discover’s records before the BRC, given that the BRC was set for March 27, 2024.

Jessica had earlier proposed moving the deposition to a date roughly a week before the BRC, noting open calendar dates of March 18, 19, 20, and 21, with a preference for a 10:00 AM or 2:00 PM start time, though she indicated flexibility on the start time. This was in the thread dated February 23, 2024, when Jessica explained Discover’s anticipated response time and the desire to schedule Ms. Graser’s deposition prior to the BRC, if possible.

The chronology also reveals that, on February 14, 2024, Jessica sent a corrected deposition notice and asked Sarena to discard the earlier notice and use the attached revised notice. The corrected Zoom link for the deposition was for a session titled Depo/Nancy Graser re Keith Graser, scheduled for February 29, 2024, at 10:00 AM Eastern Time, with the Zoom invitation details again referencing the link and Meeting ID mentioned above.

On February 12 and February 13, 2024, the parties discussed available dates. Sarena indicated that the team could do the 28th or 29th of February. Jessica then suggested February 29 at 10:00 AM, asking if that time would work, and Sarena agreed that 10:00 AM would be fine. By February 14, Jessica confirmed she had attached the notice and that the correct Zoom link was provided, with Sarena acknowledging the 10:00 AM start time.

In summary, the deposition of Ms. Nancy Graser (re Keith Graser) was being coordinated amid concurrent discovery delays related to Discover’s production of account information. The parties initially explored late February dates, then shifted to early March to accommodate Discover’s timeline and the upcoming BRC. Ultimately, on February 27, 2024, the deposition was cancelled due to Mrs. Graser’s March 21, 2024 doctor appointment that could not be reasonably rescheduled, with an option to reschedule for March 26, 2024, or to conduct the deposition after the BRC once the parties could advise the Administrative Law Judge that they had been awaiting Discover’s response.

episodes.natural_language:
In the Estate of Keith Graser (case caption: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020), the client is the Estate of Keith Graser. The matter of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007) generated a sequence of scheduling communications between Jessica Wiedersatz of UMAK Law and Sarena Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, with Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon copied on several messages.

Beginning in early February 2024, Jessica informed Sarena that a subpoena duces tecum had been sent to Discover Financial Services to obtain account information. The subpoena’s due date was 2/26/24, but Discover indicated they could not meet that deadline and expected to respond by 3/28/24. Jessica noted that the BRC in the case was set for 3/27/24 and proposed pushing Keith Graser’s deposition to a date about a week before the BRC, asking whether dates such as 3/18, 3/19, 3/20, or 3/21 could work, and she left the start time flexible (10:00 a.m. or 2:00 p.m.). She also mentioned the start times could be adjusted and that they should call to confirm what would work for Mr. Whaley and Mr. Koon.

On 2/12/2024, Sarena replied that they could do 2/28 or 2/29. The following day, 2/13/2024, Jessica suggested proceeding with 2/29 if still available, with a 10:00 a.m. start time. On 2/14/2024, Jessica advised that she had attached a notice with the correct Zoom link and asked Sarena to use that notice, noting the link below. The “CORRECT ZOOM LINK” indicated that the Depo/Nancy Graser re Keith Graser was scheduled for 2/29/2024 at 10:00 a.m. Eastern Time, with Join Zoom Meeting at https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84513117701 and Meeting ID: 845 1311 7701.

Sarena confirmed on 2/14/2024 that 10:00 a.m. would be fine and she would note it on their calendar. A subsequent exchange on 2/23/2024 explained that Discover had not yet supplied the requested account information; Discover anticipated responding by 3/28/24, and the team hoped to receive the records before the end of March since the BRC was set for 3/27/24. Jessica proposed moving the deposition to dates that would occur about a week before the BRC (3/18, 3/19, 3/20, or 3/21) and asked for confirmation on which dates would work, reiterating that the start time could be adjusted.

By 2/26/2024, Sarena indicated that they could move the deposition to 3/21/2024. Jessica replied that she would leave the start time at 10:00 a.m. and attached an amended notice, asking to be informed if any adjustments were needed. She reiterated that the Zoom link information was on the notice and provided the link again. Later that day, Sarena affirmed the move to 3/21/2024, and Jessica stated she would update Mrs. Graser accordingly and attach the amended notice. The 2/28/2024 email thread shows Jessica confirming the 3/21 date but, in the same thread, a note from Sarena again reaffirming 3/21 as a possibility.

On 2/27/2024, Sarena informed Jessica that the deposition would have to be canceled because Mrs. Graser had a doctor appointment on 3/21/2024 that could not be rescheduled within a reasonable time frame. She proposed rescheduling to 3/26/2024 or moving the deposition to after the BRC, with the attorneys to inform the ALJ that they had been awaiting a response from Discover.

Finally, in the closing update on 2/28/2024 at 15:45:25 +0000, Jessica notified Sarena that the deposition had been moved to 3/26/2024 at 10:00 a.m. She attached the amended notice and indicated that the Zoom link information remained the same as before, providing the Zoom link: Join Zoom Meeting at https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84513117701 with Meeting ID: 845 1311 7701. She asked Sarena to advise if the time needed to be adjusted, noting that the link had not changed from what had been used previously.

Throughout the exchange, the court filing and case caption remained the same, with the case identified as Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction (2022-00007) and the client as the Estate of Keith Graser. The communications also reflect the ongoing coordination of depositions, subpoenas to Discover, and the impact of scheduling conflicts with the BRC and Mrs. Graser’s medical appointments, all while preserving the Zoom meeting details and amended notices.

episodes.natural_language:
In the Estate-of-Keith-Graser case (WC-12-07-2020), the client is the Estate of Keith Graser. On April 18, 2024, at 11:05 a.m. Eastern Time, Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email with the subject “Re: Keith Graser new report” to Aaron Whaley, with Bryce Koon and Nancy Graser copied, and with the filevine-style address for Nancy Graser included in the cc. In her message, she stated that she had “got it” but could not locate the original Barefoot report; she only saw the January addendum. She noted that the January addendum does address the employee depositions and a dental visit, and she said she would send Dr. Wolens’ addendum to Barefoot with a request for an addendum. The message concluded with Sarena’s full signature, which identifies her as a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with direct dial (502) 357-9971, office line (502) 583-4022 ext. 104, and email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, highlighted by a note that this is a new email address.

Earlier that same day, at around 10:35 a.m., Aaron Whaley replied regarding the new report from the opposing expert. He stated that the only new information the expert had provided was Nancy Graser’s second deposition and the Discover and PNC transactions. He said that Barefoot’s report should include these items, in addition to the information from the employee depositions and the affidavit from the dentist. He added that, assuming the report remains favorable, he intends to depose the opposing expert. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Nancy kswg (nancydtk1@aol.com) with the subject “Re: The Whaley Law Firm has Requested Your Signature. What is your DOB?” The email included Sarena’s signature block, which listed her title, The Whaley Law Firm, the firm’s address (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222), the direct line (502) 357-9971, the office line (502) 583-4022 ext 104, the email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and a note stating “(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).”

Earlier correspondence shows that on Tuesday, April 30, 2024 at 7:02? PM, Nancy kswg replied to the thread with, “The documents DOB is Keith's shouldn't it be mine????”

Please follow the prompts to execute the attached form. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly at (502) 583-4022 Ext 104 or Ext 114.” The message was signed by Sarena and The Whaley Law Firm, with the title “Litigation Paralegal & Workers Compensation Case Manager.”

It also included the usual guidance about questions, the option to modify the document by emailing the sender directly, and options related to managing notifications, stopping or reporting emails, or declining to sign. The message noted that if Nancy had trouble signing, she could visit the Help with Signing page in the DocuSign Support Center and could download the DocuSign App. The message concluded with the line that it was sent to Nancy by Aaron Whaley, who was using the DocuSign Electronic Signature Service, and noted that if she preferred not to receive emails from this sender, she could request to be contacted by the sender.

In summary, the case file for Estate of Keith Graser (Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020) centers on obtaining signatures via DocuSign for a Form F - Fatality document required by the Kentucky Department of Workers Claims, with communications between Nancy kswg and The Whaley Law Firm (notably Sarena Tuttle and Aaron Whaley) occurring on April 30 and May 1, 2024, and the ongoing discussion about the correct date of birth to be used in the documents.

Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: Estate of Keith Graser.

In the 2nd Addendum Request, the matter concerns the Estate of Keith Graser, born 07/07/1958. On May 1, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager with The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email addressed to Brian Dietsche (appointments@commonwealthime.com) and Jeremy Leitner (jeremy@commonwealthime.com), with Greg Whaley (agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com) and Bryce Koon (bryce@whaleylawfirm.com) copied. The email, dated 10:33:51 a.m. Eastern Time, stated: “Good morning Brian, Just touching base on this addendum to see if by chance it is ready yet.” The message included the sender’s contact details and noted a new email address for Sarena.

This message follows an earlier communication dated April 18, 2024, at approximately 11:15 a.m., in which Sarena Tuttle wrote to Brian Dietsche: “Good afternoon Brian, On September 2, 2022, Dr. Barefoot provided a record review on the above referenced patient as well as an addendum on January 18, 2024. At this time, we would like to request a 2nd addendum addressing Dr. Wolens report (attached) received from the defense counsel yesterday. We have included Dr. Wolens report as well as the deposition transcript of Keith's widow, Nancy Graser and Dr. Barefoot's previous reports. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly to discuss the matter in further detail.” The email was signed by Sarena M. Tuttle, listing her title as Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Her direct line was (502) 357-9971, and the office line was (502) 583-4022 ext 104. The signature also included her email, Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and a note indicating a new email address.

The April 18 message stated that Dr. Barefoot had previously provided a record review on September 2, 2022, and had issued an addendum on January 18, 2024. It requested a second addendum addressing Dr. Wolens’ report, which had been attached, and noted that the defense counsel had provided it the prior day. The correspondence also indicated that Dr. Wolens’ report, the deposition transcript of Keith Graser’s widow, Nancy Graser, and Dr. Barefoot’s prior reports were included. The message invited any questions and offered to discuss the matter in greater detail.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020
Client: Estate of Keith Graser

This note documents communications in the Estate of Keith Graser v. Coupe Construction regarding Nancy Graser’s deposition.

The subject of the thread appears to reference Nancy Graser’s deposition as of May 22, in two different years: the header line reads “Nancy Graser Deposition May 22, 2022,” while the body of the communications states that the deposition was taken on May 22, 2024.

On July 15, 2024, at 18:16:31 UTC, Jude Haws of Buechler-Haws Reporting sent an email to Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm. In that message, Jude attached the invoice and the transcript of Nancy Graser’s deposition, noting that the deposition was taken on May 22, 2024. He stated, “Here is the invoice and transcript of Nancy Graser's deposition taken on May 22, 2024. Please let me know if you need anything else.” Jude provided his contact number as 502-639-5239.

Later that same day, Monday, July 15, 2024, at 01:33:49 PM EDT, Sarena Tuttle replied. She asked, “Good afternoon Jude, Have you had any luck locating these transcripts?” She also listed her title as Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager and provided contact details for The Whaley Law Firm: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and noted the email address as the new one.

Prior to that, on Friday, July 12, 2024, at 11:57 AM (the record shows “11:57?AM” in the header), Sarena Tuttle wrote: “Good afternoon Jude, Thank you for such a quick response. Please forward a copy of the above reference deposition transcripts along with any related invoice as a reply to this email. If it is helpful, per KY DWC LMS 2022-00007 Claim file, you uploaded 8 pages on 05.24.2022. Unfortunately, LMS does not actually allow downloads of this document, it only notes it. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly to discuss them in further detail.” Her signature again lists the same contact details for The Whaley Law Firm and includes the note “(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).”
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Keith-Graser-WC-12-07-2020. Client: the Estate of Keith Graser.

The matter concerns a past-due invoice from Buechler-Haws Reporting for the deposition of Nancy Graser on May 24, 2022, which had been requested by the recipient of the invoice. On October 31, 2024, Jude Haws of Buechler-Haws Reporting sent a message to Bryce Koon asking him to check the attached past-due invoice and to let him know when payment could be made; the message was dated Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 03:54:56 PM EDT. Jude Haws provided the contact information for Buechler-Haws Reporting, including the phone number 502-639-5239.

On January 30, 2025, at approximately 11:02 AM (the timestamp in the chain shows 11:02?AM), Jude Haws sent another message to Bryce Koon requesting that payment be remitted on the past-due invoice for the deposition of Nancy Graser taken on May 24, 2022, that Bryce Koon had requested. This January 30, 2025 message was then forwarded by Bryce Koon to Aaron Whaley (agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com) with cc to Sarena Tuttle (sarena@whaleylawfirm.com); the forwarding occurred at 11:11:00 AM -0500 on January 30, 2025. The chain thus documents ongoing efforts to obtain payment for the deposition services tied to the Estate of Keith Graser case.
